revised_title: Long-term Potentiation of Aplysia Sensorimotor Synapses in Cell Culture: Regulation by Postsynaptic Voltage
tldr: The authors discovered that long-term potentiation (LTP) of Aplysia sensorimotor synapses in cell culture can be induced by high-frequency stimulation and is regulated by the voltage of the postsynaptic cell. This form of LTP is important for understanding the cellular mechanisms of associative learning in invertebrates.
